ygData.subject: Re: To RP together...or NOT to RP together
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi all, I just bought EQ yesterday and haven t gotten to play it yet, however I have already came up several characters that I would like to play. As to which
ygData.messageBody:
Hi all,
I just bought EQ yesterday and haven't gotten to play
it yet, however I have already came up several
characters that I would like to play. As to which
servers....don't know yet. My boyfriend and I live
with each other and are both gonna play EQ. We decided
that for our first set of characters, we will play
identical twin sisters. That is so we can watch out
for each other and learn the game easily without the
jealousy issue. Hope to see ya soon. The twins are
Katia and Katya Nadine. If ya see us, see if you can
tell which is which. Hope to hear from ya'll soon.


Elizabeth

--- Mystyrain8@... wrote:
> From: Mystyrain8@...
>
> In a message dated 6/17/99 8:07:24 AM Mountain
> Daylight Time,
> janeways@... writes:
>
> << As for significant others I was quite amazed to
> read that some that are
> married don't "play" that in EQ >>
>
> I really dont find it that amazing, but then I am
> one of the ones that dont
> RP that relationship with my RL husband in game. In
> game we RP brother and
> sister. The main reason that came about was (no
> lectures please ::chuckles)
> we fought so much initially about the game. He
> would die...and get upset
> with me. I would level past him...he would get
> upset with me. Basically
> what Im saying is that, though we love each other
> deeply, we are also
> entirely too competitive with each other. Another
> reason was, we have
> complete opposite styles of RP (personality wise)
> and if i spend too long
> with him in game i want to do something (like give
> him the biggest wedgie of
> his life) to make him lighten up. He can be a bit
> stuffy. Needless to say,
> it makes me want to pull my hair out. So we
> determined a very long time ago
> that our characters were not meant to be together in
> "that" way.
>
> It actually works very well for us. And, from the
> brother and sister
> standpoint, we actually work very well. We can also
> climb in bed at night
> without the danger of a "game" sending us off to
> sleep angry with each other.
> And we DO get together from time to time to help
> each other out.
>
> In Light,
>
> The player behind Mystyrain
>
>

> choice!

> homepage for details.
